error.signature: Error creating: pods is forbidden: no PriorityClass with name found

verdict.summary: Pod references a PriorityClass that doesn't exist in the cluster. The PriorityClass must be created before pods can use it.

dead_ends.action: Remove priorityClassName from the pod spec
dead_ends.why_fails: Pod loses scheduling priority — may be preempted by other workloads

dead_ends.action: Use a numeric priority value directly
dead_ends.why_fails: Kubernetes requires a PriorityClass resource — numeric priority is set on the PriorityClass, not the pod

workarounds.how:
kubectl apply -f - <<EOF
apiVersion: scheduling.k8s.io/v1
kind: PriorityClass
metadata:
  name: <name>
value: 1000000
globalDefault: false
EOF

workarounds.action: List existing PriorityClasses and use one that already exists
workarounds.how: kubectl get priorityclasses to see available classes

leads_to.condition: when PriorityClass is created but preemption doesn't free enough resources

preceded_by.condition: when applying manifests with PriorityClass references before creating the class

frequently_confused_with.distinction: PriorityClass not found is a validation error at pod creation, while FailedScheduling is a runtime scheduling failure after the pod is accepted
